Articles.Content:
As someone who spends the majority of their time in the Spaceplane Hangar, i personally can say that this craft turned out better than expected. As you probably saw in the title, this is a Do-226 replica. It's not one to one, but a very close approximation. It's armed with 3 .50 caliber turrets (BDarmory) and seats 3.

 

Reference picture:

Edited March 20, 2016 by THE NARWHAL
broken imgur

Seems great.

But there is really a number of A. E. R. O. B. R. E. A. K. S. 

by the way, what is the efficient way to complete a water-takeoff?

7 hours ago, virtualizerocket said:

Seems great.

But there is really a number of A. E. R. O. B. R. E. A. K. S. 

by the way, what is the efficient way to complete a water-takeoff?

You've got to let it speed up a lot, then pull up. If you pull up while it's speeding up, the floats drag into the water and slow you down. And yes, the aerobrakes are numerous, but they're used to slow the plane down on water.
